alert.note: Alert for Mora; San Miguel (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 10 at 4:24PM MDT until September 10 at 6:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... The Hermits Peak and Calf Canyon Burn Scar in... Southwestern Mora County in northeastern New Mexico... Northwestern San Miguel County in northeastern New Mexico... * Until 630 PM MDT. * At 424 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated showers producing moderate rain over the Hermits Peak and Calf Canyon Burn Scar. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen west of El Porvenir and San Ignacio. Significant flooding in and near Beaver Creek and Gallinas Creek is likely ongoing. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will impact the Tecolote Creek and Gallinas River drainage areas including Cabo Lucero Creek, Canon Mesteno, Ojitos Frios Creek, Tecolote Creek, Porvenir Canyon, Arroyo Pecos, Agua Zarca and Vegosa Creek. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Hermits Peak and Calf Canyon Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Hermits Peak and Calf Canyon Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Las Vegas, El Porvenir, Montezuma, Sapello, Tierra Monte, Storrie Lake State Park, Gascon, Ledoux, Morphy Lake State Park, Gallinas, Mineral Hill, Rociada, Manuelitas, San Geronimo, San Pablo, South Carmen, Ojitos Frios and Monte Aplanado. This includes the following highways... State Road 94 between Mile Markers 1 and 16. State Road 518 between Mile Markers 1 and 15. State Road 283 between Mile Markers 1 and 12...and near Mile Marker 14. Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 344 and 348. State Road 276 between Mile Markers 0 and 5. State Road 266 between Mile Markers 0 and 6. State Road 65 between Mile Markers 1 and 14. State Road 105 between Mile Markers 0 and 9. This includes the following low water crossings... West Las Vegas High School, Mills Bridge and Valencia Street. This includes the following recreation areas... E.V. Long Campground, El Porvenir Campground, Morphy Lake State Park and Storrie Lake State Park. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon fire burn area. Do not camp along streams and rivers. Remain alert when hiking in steep, narrow canyons. Know where you are relative to low spots and drainages.
